channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The entire road is full of potholes which damage cars which have to drive down here as they live here. Itâ€™s unacceptable, 27th March
item.description:
The entire length of Hanover Street is covered in large potholes and loose road. It is damaging cars which the owner then has to pay to rectify. This has been the case for at least the last year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Hanover Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previously reported issues on missing and broken drain covers have been identified as 'Fixed' by yourselves on 13 March 2025. This is not the case, as all you have done is surround the drains with barriers, 27th March
item.description:
Drain outside No32 Meadow Lea is damaged and another drain cover in car parking area is missing. Further drain in car parking area is blocked
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadow Lea, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Park needs updating, 27th March
item.description:
For such a lovely area with one of the highest council tax brackets, this park is one of the worst in the borough. The people and children have looked after this park with no graffiti or damage, unlike some. Please update this play area as it's in much need of a revamp.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilford Avenue, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -FW6 Potholes problem, 27th March
item.description:
28 day with give an take plus temporary footway closure needed footway pothole 300x300x30mm tarmac patch required stats required (FW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Since the dropped kerb has been allowed the surface of the access is dangerously collapsing., 27th March
item.description:
The vehicular access to The Willows Southam Lane has compromised the safety of Gravel Walk, with extra vehicles constantly using this narrow lane. The edge of the stream has been compromised by a sub standard method used. To access this property vehicles have to take care not to damage our entrance. No consideration was given when permission was granted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Walk, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
